iati-activity.title: Thematic aid to the Centre on Housing Rights and Evictions (COHRE)
iati-activity.description: To promote housing rights on local, regional and international level

iati-activity.title: PROJECT PREPARATION
iati-activity.description: PROJECT PLANNING

iati-activity.title: DECISION SUPPORT AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT PROG. MEKONG RIVER
iati-activity.description: MEKONG RIVER COMMISSION NEEDS A COMPUTER BASED SYSTEM FOR DECISION SUPPORT AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT. THERE WILL BE FIRST A PREPARATION PHAASE AND BASED ON THAT THE DECISION ON THE IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE MADE.

iati-activity.title: CENTRAL ASIAN REGIONAL INFORMATION AND COORDINATION CENTRE
iati-activity.description: TO ESTABLISH A CENTRAL ASIAN REGIONAL INFORMATION AND COORDINATION CENTRE CARICC

iati-activity.title: SUPPORT THROUGH AIT-TRUST FUND V
iati-activity.description: FINLAND PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR THE PULP AND PAPER TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMME AND ICT AND TC PROGRAMMES. SUPPORT IS PROVIDED THROUGH FACULTY AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS.

iati-activity.title: Mekong Core Environmental Programme (CEP)
iati-activity.description: Core Environmental Programme is one of nine sectoral programmes of the overriding GMS Programme. The CEP will empower GMS countries to effectively manage their environment and economic development to achieve an overall and sustainable improvement in people's lives. CEP was prepared and developed with strong participation from regional partners and six member countries.

iati-activity.title: Mekong Private Sector Development Facility (MPDF) through IFC
iati-activity.description: Development and business suppport to the local, private small and medium size enterprices (SMEs) in Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Regional Coordination. The Regional Coordination Programme focuses on increasing the capacity of project personnel to carry out high quality holistic development work in South East Asia. In addition_ it aims to improve the mainstreaming process in the region. The programme started in 2001 and soon proved so effective that similar programmes were established in other regions as well. Regional coordination is now an integral part of the global Fida strategy. In South East Asia_ Fida partners with a large number of NGOs_ churches and even government departments. The main focus of the programme is to network the partners with each other. In addition_ it offers the partners training in the areas of e.g. project administration and financial management. Special attention is also paid to training on gender_ HIV/AIDS and other mainstreaming themes. As the partners are brought together_ they will be able to share lessons learned and create partnerships with each other. Together they form a well-functioning network that implements high quality holistic development work.

iati-activity.title: Mekong River Commission (MRC); Water Management Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: The MRC Water Management Trust Fund was established in August 2005. The objective of the fund is to provide strategic and flexible support to MRC programme development and a facility for the MRC to develop and implement its programme responding to short-term demand of member countries in fulfilling its transboundary water resources management and development.

iati-activity.title: Mekong River Commission (MRC); Integrated Capacity Building
iati-activity.description: Developing young riparian professionals in areas related to integrated water resources management is one of the three key components of the MRC Integrated Capacity Building Programme. The first phase of the Junior Riparian Professionals Project began in 2002 and lasted for four years. The objective of the second phase is to provide training and hands-on experience to young riparian professionals in core areas of integrated water resources management in the context of Mekong Cooperation.

iati-activity.title: Mekong Region Waters Dialogue Programme through IUCN
iati-activity.description: The overall goal of the Water Dialogues program is to improve livelihood security, human and ecosystem health in the Mekong Region through improving water governance. The overall objective of the programme is to develop alternative models of environmental decision-making in the context of water resources governance in the Mekong Region by examining the limitations of state-dominant processes and inquire into the potentials of greater civil-society involvement in these processes. The program will seek to find improved structures to foster regional and global cooperation, and to promote livelihood security and reduce conflict in relation to water resources, at all levels from the local to the regional. IUCN will build on its convening role to bring State and non-state actors together to address the governance challenges of water resources management in the Mekong Region.
iati-activity.participating-org: International Union for the Conservation of Nature
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Mekong River Commission Adviser
iati-activity.description: Strengthening the capacity of the Mekong River Commission
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: A development aim is to increase awareness through education, influence policies regarding HIV and workplaces, and develop work communities through seminars and events to increase workers' safety and prevent the spread of the disease.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: The project's aims are: countries have common strategies to achieve a reduction of child labour in the textile sector; support the education of ex-child labourers; and strengthen the unions.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: With the knowledge and experience gained in the first phase of the projects, unions are now able to develop clear objectives and deal with the issues of greatest need, which are defined specifically for each country.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: This project continues the process of developing the individual sector unions to influence the preparatory phase and implementation phases of a project to ensure union and workers rights. The activities in this project are part of the PSI overall ADB campaign; the regional and international component will also support the national activities.

iati-activity.title: Project preparation in Mekong
iati-activity.description: The funds are dedicated for the Finnish Embassy in Bangkok to perform identification_ preparation_ monitoring and steering_ and evaluation of development cooperation interventions_ as well as other tasks related to the implementation of Finnish development policy on the country-level.

iati-activity.title: Asian Development Fund 10
iati-activity.description: Finland's share of the 10th replenishment for the Asian Development Fund

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Black Sea Peacebuilding Network
iati-activity.description: Four leading think-tanks and NGOs from Armenia_ R. Moldova_ Georgia and Azerbaijan and CMI aim to motor a Black Sea regional network of non-governmental organizations on peace-building issues with strong linkages at the European level. The objectives of the network are to foster local ownership and regional collaboration between peacebuilding organizations in the black Sea area; to improve learning from the four conflict-settings (Transnistria_ Abkhazia_ South Ossetia and Nagorno-Karabakh) and to identify common approaches for key regional actors and EU_ to strenghten peace-building capacities at local level (the policy and grass roots levels) and to ensure efficient communication and aadvocacy at the EU policy level through a web of relations with EU institutions_ member states and European NGOs.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Administrative cost of MFA central administration for ASIA_ REGIONAL
iati-activity.description: Administrative cost of MFA central administration for ASIA_ REGIONAL. Costs generated from the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Helsinki

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Regional Disaster Preparedness and Risk Management . To enhance the capacity of the rural poor communities/households to address the adverse impacts of low and uneven rainfall, drought and other natural calamities as consequences of climate change on their lives and livelihoods as well as reduce poverty

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
iati-activity.description: Human Trafficking in Asia. To ensure protection and rights of vulnerable people who are seeking alternative livelihood strategies and thereby subject to unsafe migration and trafficking

location.name: Nepal, India, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Thailand, Malaysia

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Human Rights and Democracy in Central Asia
iati-activity.description: Project aims to enhance durable democratic development, to participate preventing the conflicts and to support the peace building by growing locally the capacity of the partner organisations for them to able follow up the violations of freedom of expression and human rights. One aim in the project is to support the local and global networking.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Mekong Regional Water Dialogue Phase II
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the project is to mainstream participation by multiple stakeholders including communities and civil society, in decision making related to management of water resources for strengthening the sustainability of livelihoods and equity of benefit sharing in the Lower Mekong Region.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Energy and Environment Partnership Programme with the Mekong Region
iati-activity.description: Energy and environment partnership with Mekong region (Cambodia, Lao PDR, Thailand, Vietnam) to improve access and promote more efficient use of renewable energy of rural houselholds, livelihoods and SME's and to contribute to abatement of greenhouse gases. Projects will be developed with the support of studies, policy development and capacity building that have potential for sustainable financing. Pilots and demonstrations are promoted.

iati-activity.title: Follow-up local co-operation funds
iati-activity.description: To follow-up the local cooperation funds, quality control and to cover the services of possible external experts.

iati-activity.title: Capacity building of forest inventory methods and techniques in Nepal and Vietnam
iati-activity.description: A 3-year Inter-institutional cooperation project between the Finnish Forest Research Institute and Depart. of Forest Research and Survey in Nepal, Forestry Inventory and Planning Institute in Vietnam as well as Nepalese and Vietnamese institutes for higher education in forestry. Aim is to: improve the partner agencies' capabilities in data acquisition and analysis, environmental monitoring, and reporting of forest resources and statistics; strengthen the research and development as well as educational capacity related to the forest inventory methods and techniques; long-term partnership between the institutions. Activities include twinning type of capacity building, workshops, courses, dissemination of results.

iati-activity.title: InfoDEV Multi Donor Trust Fund for Asia 2010-2012
iati-activity.description: Trust Fund is producing knowledge and good practices how ITC is applied to the achievement of development goals, how enabling environment needs to be developed for implementation of applications and how public-private partnerships can be fostered to support entrepreneurship,growth and innovation.

iati-activity.title: Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services ICI-project
iati-activity.description: Finnish Meteorological Institute and the Department of Hydrlogy and Meteorology under the Ministry of Environment have together proposed a ICI-project for Increased Capacity of Hydrometeorological Services in Nepal. The project aims to improve the capacity of DHM in hydrometeorological observations, services and international data sharing and thus improve the capability of the Government of Nepal to respond to the increased risks of natural disasters related to weather and climate.

iati-activity.title: Support to FLEGT process in Vietnam and Laos
iati-activity.description: To make available a FLEGT advisor that support the implementation of the EU FLEGT Action Plan in Vietnam and in Laos, with emphasis on forest and timber industry governance reform, and trans boundary trade in the Mekong sub-region; to provide support to the Governments and stakeholders of Vietnam and Laos to come to an effective bilateral or trilateral FLEGT arrangement aimed ensuring that exports of timber products to the EU are made of legally harvested timber.

location.name: Laos and Vietnam as focus; Mekong region

iati-activity.title: Mekong Region Forest and Climate Support
iati-activity.description: Local communities need information of better form and accuracy to be able to access forest product and services markets and obtain a higher share in value creation. Payments environmental services including carbon mitigation are increasingly available but local communities are as yet unable to capture these markets or even comprehend them. They need better information about their forest resources to be able to access such schemes. The goal of the project: Local people gaining additional benefits through improved access to forest product and carbon markets and payments for environmental services, contributing to poverty reduction,enhancement of environmental conditions, and mitigation and better adaptation to climate change.

location.name: Mekong area (Kambodzha, Lao PDR., Thailand and Vietnam)

iati-activity.title: Secondment of a CDM expert to Asian Development Bank HQ in Manila
iati-activity.description: Finland has done preparations for seconding a CDM-specialist to ADB's HQ in Manila for a period of two years. The seconded person would mainly work with the Future Carbon Fund (managed by ADB). The specialist's job description would include i) on policy level: aiding the bank's teams and the developing member countries (DMCs) in identifying the possibilities created by the carbon market and ii) on operational level identifying, developing and follow-up of CDM-projects, analyzing and implementing CDM-capacity building needs both within the bank and in the DMCs as well as generally spreading carbon market related knowledge.

iati-activity.title: Support services for land use and mapping projects
iati-activity.description: There is a need for expert services in support of preparation and follow-up of projects related to land use and mapping, in particular in the Mekong region. The National Land Survey has provided this expert support previously and the Asia and Oseania Unit would like to continue this collaboration in the framework of a 2-year agreement.

iati-activity.title: Support to the Mekong River Commission
iati-activity.description: The mission of the Mekong River Commision is to promote and coordinate sustainable management and development of water and related resources for the countries' mutual benefit and the people's well-being in the Mekong River Base. Finland's support to the MRC in 2011-14 consists of three programmes: Information and Knowledge Management Programme (7 MEUR), Initiative for Sustainable Hydropower (3 MEUR), and Integrated Capacity Building Programme (Junior Riparian Professionals)(1 MEUR).

location.name: Mekong region (Vietnam, Thailand, Lao PDR, Cambodia, Myanmar, China/Yunnan)

iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: ODA equity through Finnfund
iati-activity.description: ODA equity through Finnfund, Fund to invest in renewable energy.

iati-activity.title: The Caucasus Crossroads: Buildging Interactive Dialogue
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to bring together professional and citizen journalists from all the coutries of South Caucasus via network of journalists, media outlets and reprersentatives of civil society. This will be done by regular training workshops and civil society missions, during which a group of people representing different countries and regions will work together. The results of this work will appear on project website utilizing possibilities of new media. The aim of the project is to streghten the communication and quality of media and enhance the freedom of speech.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (SASK)
iati-activity.description: Global network, Asia

iati-activity.title: ASEM Education Hub for Peace and Conlict Studies
iati-activity.description: Thematic Network on Peace and Conflict Studies of the ASEM Education Hub Program aims to launch and implement policy relevant teaching and research projects on peace and conflict studien in various Asian conflict zones.
iati-activity.sector: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Long term partnership with a local company / organisation (e.g. joint venture; subcontractor, import or other contract agreement )
